title: Snow
description:
Snow offers an intimate photographic exploration of Kars, a Turkish city steeped in centuries of complex history. Once the capital of Armenian kingdoms and later a strategic frontier for Byzantines, Seljuks, and Ottomans, Kars embodies the cultural and political entanglements of empires.

Limited Edition: 500; Format: Hardcover; Printing: Four Colour Offset; Dimensions: 120 pages, 210 × 280 mm; ISBN: 978-3-911782-00-5; Year: 2025

title: Bury Me in the Back Forty
description:
Bury Me in the Back Forty is the highly anticipated successor to the sold-out books Out West and Crown Ditch by Kyler Zeleny and the final chapter in his prairie trilogy. For a decade now, Kyler Zeleny has been documenting his hometown, a rural community on the Canadian Prairies with deep Ukrainian roots, consisting of 915 people. Based on the idea that the story of any place evolves over time, Zeleny has been using his own photographs, collected objects, community archives, and hidden histories, to revise the community’s history book from the year 1980.

Limited Edition: 600; Format: Hardcover; Printing: Four Colour Offset; Dimensions: 168 pages, 210 × 267 mm; ISBN: 978-1-908889-96-6; Year: 2024

title: Non-Structures
description:
The series Non-Structures presents London — and cities in general — as a spectacle of constant conflict, negotiation and flux. Capturing key moments in the life of diverse buildings, the images reveal a condition of transience, trapped as these buildings and sites are between the boundaries of architecture and ruin, planning and chance, process and product. The term “Non-Structures” alludes to anthropologist Marc Augé’s influential work Non-Places; this boundary condition, defined by an absence of identity, has lent its name to the series.

Limited Edition: 500; Format: Softcover; Dimensions: 144 pages, 230 × 310 mm

title: HappySad Souvenirs
description:
Happysad Souvenirs is a series of photographs taken in 2018 and 2019 during Hiller’s travels through China, Japan, Singapore, Thailand, Taiwan and Vietnam.

Limited Edition: 500; Format: Hardcover; Dimensions: 64 pages, 210 × 230 mm; Year: 2021

title: The Death and Life of Great Asian Cities Ⅱ
description:
The Death and Life of Great Asian Cities Vol II is the second in a three-part series containing work from over seven years of photographing cities in Asia. It is critical commentary of the state of Asian cities in the 21st century. This volume includes images from Kyoto, Jakarta, Osaka, Hualien, Tainan, Keelung, Taipei, Bangkok, Busan and Taichung.

Limited Edition: 500; Format: Softcover; Printing: Four Colour Offset; Dimensions: 80 pages, 148 × 210 mm; ISBN: 978-1-908889-91-1; Year: 2021

title: Linz Diary
description:
Peter Bialobrzeski visits Linz, Austria. It was a provincial and local government city of the Holy Roman Empire, and an important trading point connecting several routes, on either side of the river Danube from the east to the west and Bohemia and Poland from north to the Balkans and Italy to the south. Hitler considered Linz to be his hometown. Linz Diary was shot between 18th and the 29th 2017 and is the 14th instalment in the City Diary series.

Limited Edition: 500; Format: Swiss Binding; Printing: Four Colour Offset; Dimensions: 112 pages, 140 × 210 mm; ISBN: 978-1-908889-90-4; Year: 2021

title: Belfast Diary
description:
Peter Bialobrzeski visits Belfast, Northern Ireland. Belfast suffered greatly during the violence that accompanied the partition of Ireland, and especially during the more recent conflict known as the Troubles. Belfast Diary was shot between 18th and the 29th 2017 and is the 14th instalment in the City Diary series.

Limited Edition: 500; Format: Swiss Binding; Dimensions: 112 pages, 140 × 210 mm; ISBN: 978-1-908889-89-8

title: Minsk Diary
description:
Peter Bialobrzeski visits the Belarussian capital, Minsk. Minsk the 11th most populous city in Europe. Minsk is the administrative capital of the Commonwealth of Independent States (CIS). Between 1919 to 1991, after the Russian Revolution, Minsk was the capital of the Byelorussian Soviet Socialist Republic, in the Soviet Union. Minsk Diary was shot between 15th – 23th April 2018 and is the 13th instalment in the City Diary series.

Limited Edition: 500; Format: Swiss Binding; Printing: Four Colour Offset; Dimensions: 112 pages, 140 × 210 mm; ISBN: 978-1-908889-88-1

title: Yangon Diary
description:
Peter Bialobrzeski visits the city of Yangon. With over 7 million people, Yangon is Myanmar’s most populous city and its most important commercial centre. Yangon Diary was shot between 21 Feb – 1 Mar 2019 and is the 11th instalment in the City Diary series.

Limited Edition: 500; Format: Swiss Binding; Printing: Four Colour Offset; Dimensions: 112 pages, 140 × 210 mm; ISBN: 978-1-908889-87-4

title: Dhaka Diary
description:
Peter Bialobrzeski turns his gaze on the city of Dhaka, the capital city of Bangladesh, the fourth-most densely populous city in the world with a population of over 21 million residents in the Greater Dhaka Area. Capturing its crowded streets and back-alleys, Bialobrzeski’s images reveal a city in constant state of development. Dhaka Diary was shot between 21 Feb – 1 Mar 2019 and is the 11th instalment in the City Diary series.

Limited Edition: 500; Format: Swiss Binding; Printing: Four Colour Offset; Dimensions: 112 pages, 140 × 210 mm; ISBN: 978-1-908889-86-7

title: Suburban Bus
description:
Between 1993 and 2004, Alejandro Cartagena would commute almost daily on a suburban bus from Monterrey to the suburban city of Juarez and back. Working at his family’s restaurant, he watched the gradual changes happening in Juarez. Between 2000 and 2005, the city went from a population of 66,000 to 144,000. He watched Juarez be eaten up, all through the window of the bus.

Limited Edition: 500; Format: Softcover encased in Cardboard; Printing: Four Colour Offset; Dimensions: 352 pages, 163 × 240 mm; ISBN: 978-1-908889-84-3; Year: 2021

title: Falling Water
description:
In a series of black and white images, Falling Water captures dam infrastructure across Japan and the USA.

Limited Edition: 500; Format: Hardcover, Thread-Binding; Dimensions: 64 pages, 280 × 320 mm

title: A Small Guide to Homeownership
description:
A Small Guide to Homeownership is an amalgamation of 13 years of work, starting with Cartagena’s Fragmented Cities series made between 2005 and 2009 in which he documented the suburbanization of the Monterrey metro area in northern Mexico. This project began an exploration that led him to document the changes that this development brought to the city; from transportation, urban planning, infrastructure development, private and public bureaucracy, the challenges in people’s daily life to the ecological consequences of this unplanned growth.

Limited Edition: 500; Format: Softcover; Dimensions: 360 pages, 152 × 229 mm; ISBN: 978-1-908889-73-7; Year: 2022

title: Crown Ditch & The Prairie Castle
description:
Over a period of four years, Kyler Zeleny travelled the prairie lands of North America, driving over 15,000 km in the process to photograph and document their current realities. The prairies is an extensive region encompassing parts of both Canada and the U.S. suffering from a loss of heritage and uncertain about its future as society continues to move in the direction of mass urbanisation.

Limited Edition: 500; Format: Hardcover with Linen-Cloth; Dimensions: 96 pages, 210 × 250 mm; ISBN: 978-1-908889-71-3

title: Khmer Concrete
description:
Khmer Concrete investigates what remains of Cambodia’s post-independence architectural heritage and how it still retains its poetic power in contemporary Cambodia. The development of an independent intellectual and cultural elite was seen as crucial to maintaining Cambodia’s international status and independence in the years after 1953. In addition to architecture, a vibrant art and culture scene developed which sought to express itself on the international stage. All this came to an end, however, when the Khmer Rouge seized power and laid waste to the countryside and cities of Cambodia between 1975 and 1980. Khmer Concrete explores the forgotten legacy of these buildings and their place in modern Cambodia.

Limited Edition: 500; Format: Hardcover; Dimensions: 64 pages, 210 × 250 mm; ISBN: 978-1-908889-70-6

title: Napoli Nord
description:
Napoli Nord explores the Roma camps on the northern outskirts of Napoli. The project documents the houses built by the Roma population, their interiors and their inhabitants. Instead of portraying its precarious housing and decay, Vincenzo’s images undermine our prejudices and offer us an insight into an oft-misunderstood world.

Limited Edition: 500; Format: Hardcover; Dimensions: 80 pages, 240 × 215 mm; ISBN: 978-1-908889-69-0

title: The Death and Life of Great Asian Cities Ⅰ
description:
The Death and Life of Great Asian Cities Vol II is the second in a three-part series containing work from over seven years of photographing cities in Asia. It is critical commentary of the state of Asian cities in the 21st century. This volume includes images from Kyoto, Jakarta, Osaka, Hualien, Tainan, Keelung, Taipei, Bangkok, Busan and Taichung.

Limited Edition: 500; Format: Softcover; Dimensions: 80 pages, 148 × 210 mm; ISBN: 978-1-908889-91-1

title: Budapest Diary
description:
In Budapest Diary — the 9th instalment in the City Diary series — Peter Bialobrzeski turns his gaze on the Hungary’s capital — a city at the centre of Europe’s recent flirtation with populism. Shot between 18 – 24 Sep 2017, Bialobrzeski’s images reveal a city with both historic and modern elements, forging its way in a new era.

Limited Edition: 500; Format: Swiss Binding; Dimensions: 112 pages, 140 × 210 mm; ISBN: 978-1-908889-66-9

title: Zurich Diary
description:
In Zurich Diary — the 8th instalment in the City Diary series — Peter Bialobrzeski turns his gaze on the Swiss city of Zurich, the largest city in Switzerland with a population of almost 2 million. Known the world over as a financial centre, with its many financial institutions and banks, the city lies at the tip of Lake Zurich. Zurich Diary was shot between 20 Feb – 4 Mar 2018.

Limited Edition: 500; Format: Swiss Binding; Dimensions: 112 pages, 140 × 210 mm; ISBN: 978-1-908-8896-52

title: Wuhan Diary
description:
In Wuhan Diary — the 7th instalment in the City Diary series — Peter Bialobrzeski turns his gaze on the Chinese city of Wuhan — now infamous as the source of Covid-19 in late 2019. Shot between 22 Feb – 12 Mar 2017, Bialobrzeski’s images reveal a bustling city of over 19 million coming to terms with its own rapid development.

Limited Edition: 500; Format: Swiss Binding; Dimensions: 112 pages, 140 × 210 mm; Year: 2018

title: Osaka Diary
description:
Peter Bialobrzeski turns his gaze on the city of Osaka, the traditional economic hub of Japan, and one of the largest metropolitan areas in the world with more than 20 million inhabitants. Capturing its wide boulevards and hidden back-alleys, Bialobrzeski’s images reveal a city in constant flux. Osaka Diary was shot between 17 – 23 August 2015 and is the 10th instalment in the City Diary series.

Limited Edition: 500; Format: Swiss Binding; Dimensions: 112 pages, 140 × 210 mm

title: The City in Itself
description:
The City in Itself is a body of work that explores the variety of architectural elements that make up a city; in this case Tokyo. Hutchinson sees this project as a departure point allowing him to explore a new personal perspective, one that closely examines the social and economic framework of the city.

Limited Edition: 300; Format: Saddle-Stitch; Dimensions: 32 pages, 152 × 193 mm

title: Japanscapes
description:
“Infrastructure is the main subject of my photography. Infrastructure represents the time and space of the era, in various ways. I have traveled all over Japan many times. But if I go over it closely, there are so many unknown places still that it makes me feel overwhelmed.” – Toshio Shibata

Limited Edition: 500; Format: Hardcover, Thread-Binding; Dimensions: 64 pages, 200 × 250 mm; ISBN: 978-1-908889-54-6; Year: 2017

title: A Guide to Infrastructure & Corruption
description:
A Guide to Infrastructure and Corruption is a long-term project that I started in 2009 when the opportunity to become a conscious citizen arose. A new overpass was to be built a block away from my house in Monterrey, Mexico, changing the transit and flow for everyone who lived in the the immediate area. Having lived downtown since 2007, I suddenly felt that we were being affected by these new infrastructure complexes so that they could supply a quick way for people to get out of the city and into the newly built suburbs that I was photographing at the time.  — Alejandro Cartagena

Limited Edition: 500; Format: Hardcover, Tape-Bound; Dimensions: 192 pages, 140 × 210 mm

title: Kochi Nights
description:
Forty images from the outer tip of the subcontinent, using only light sources already available in the streets. Kochi, India, a region that has been the site of ever shifting power arrangements ever since Portuguese sailors landed in 16th century, and a place where history is still ever-present in the city’s landscape.

Limited Edition: 400; Format: Hardcover with Sewn Binding; Dimensions: 80 pages, 148 × 200 mm

title: Kochi Diary
description:
In Kochi Dairy — the 5th installment in the City Diary series — Bialobrzeski turns his gaze on the city of Kochi, on the Indian subcontinent. Kochi Diary was shot in July 2016.

Limited Edition: 500; Format: Swiss Binding; Dimensions: 112 pages, 140 × 210 mm

title: Tales from Beneath the Arches
description:
Tales from Beneath the Arches explores the transformation of ‘non-places’ created by the mass building of elevated highways and expressways in Taiwanese cities. This project examines how such spaces have been repurposed by people to suit their needs. It is in these spaces that we can see the interaction between people and the built environment in one of the densest urban landscapes in the world.

Limited Edition: 500; Format: Hardcover, Section-Sewn; Dimensions: 80 pages, 210 × 260 mm

title: Hotel Okinawa
description:
Japan’s southernmost prefecture, Okinawa, hosts a concentration of US military bases unlike anywhere outside the continental United States. More than half the 50,000 US troops stationed in Japan are based here. Hotel Okinawa looks at this unique world “on base” and off, separate and yet conjoined, the result of decades of living in close proximity with the US military. Additionally, archival photographs, periodicals and other artefacts, some dating back to the US occupation, appear throughout the book, registering historical strands that are part of the complex fabric of Okinawa today.

Limited Edition: 500; Format: Hardcover, Section-Sewn; Dimensions: 192 pages, 210 × 250 mm

title: Beirut Diary
description:
“I cross a road I am not supposed to cross. [.…] As I walk towards the building, I am spotted by a man who runs a coffee stall in the basement. His initial communication over 50 yards is the international sign for 'come here and we’ll cut your throat'. The New York Times nominated Beirut as #1 in its list of The 44 places to Go in 2009.”

Limited Edition: 500; Format: Swiss Binding; Dimensions: 112 pages, 140 × 210 mm

title: Mountains and Waters
description:
Mountains and Waters is a photographic study of China in diptychs, shot on the outskirts of Shanghai, Chongqing and Shenzhen in China. The works focus on contemporary Chinese matters such as construction, infrastructure and development, while simultaneously alluding to traditional Chinese painting styles.

Limited Edition: 750; Format: Hardcover, Section-Sewn; Printing: Four Colour Offset; Dimensions: 120 pages, 210 × 240 mm

title: Wolfsburg Diary
description:
In Wolfsburg Diary — the 3rd instalment in the City Diary series — Bialobrzeski turns his gaze on his childhood city of Wolfsburg. Shot in late 2015, Wolfsburg Diary captures a city built on socialist ambitions and the scene of the unfolding VW scandal.

Limited Edition: 800; Format: Swiss Binding; Dimensions: 112 pages, 140 × 210 mm

title: Taipei Diary
description:
The Velvet Cell is an independent photo­book publishing house based in Bremen, Germany, run by Ricardo Nunes. Established by Éanna de Fréine in 2011, we wanted to create a publishing house that connects new and established authors to a wider audience through the medium of beautifully designed editions. We are rooted primarily in the themes of modernity, urbanisation and the man-altered world — using the photo­book as a medium for this conversation.

Limited Edition: 500; Format: Swiss Binding; Dimensions: 112 pages, 140 × 210 mm; ISBN: 978-1-908889-30-0

title: Athens Diary
description:
The Velvet Cell is an independent photo­book publishing house based in Bremen, Germany, run by Ricardo Nunes. Established by Éanna de Fréine in 2011, we wanted to create a publishing house that connects new and established authors to a wider audience through the medium of beautifully designed editions. We are rooted primarily in the themes of modernity, urbanisation and the man-altered world — using the photo­book as a medium for this conversation.

Limited Edition: 500; Format: Swiss Binding; Dimensions: 112 pages, 140 × 210 mm; ISBN: 978-1-908889-29-4

title: Norilsk
description:
The Velvet Cell is an independent photo­book publishing house based in Bremen, Germany, run by Ricardo Nunes. Established by Éanna de Fréine in 2011, we wanted to create a publishing house that connects new and established authors to a wider audience through the medium of beautifully designed editions. We are rooted primarily in the themes of modernity, urbanisation and the man-altered world — using the photo­book as a medium for this conversation.

Limited Edition: 500; Format: Hand-Bound, Section-Sewn; Printing: Four Colour Offset; Dimensions: 64 pages, 140 × 230 mm; ISBN: 978-1-908889-25-6

title: Out West
description:
The Velvet Cell is an independent photo­book publishing house based in Bremen, Germany, run by Ricardo Nunes. Established by Éanna de Fréine in 2011, we wanted to create a publishing house that connects new and established authors to a wider audience through the medium of beautifully designed editions. We are rooted primarily in the themes of modernity, urbanisation and the man-altered world — using the photo­book as a medium for this conversation.

Limited Edition: 500; Format: Section-Sewn with Card Cover; Dimensions: 112 pages, 148 × 210 mm; ISBN: 978-1-908889-24-9

title: Frameworks
description:
Across Europe one finds buildings that lie unfinished, some are skeletal in form and purpose. These concrete forms represent a stage in the architectural process that, in their case, may never be completed. Frames with nothing to support languish in their abandonment. Here we see architecture paused; construction has ceased and we are left with the bones of buildings in stasis.

Limited Edition: 300; Format: Saddle-Stitch; Dimensions: 28 pages, 152 × 193 mm; ISBN: 978-1-908889-23-2; Year: 2016

title: Cairo Diary
description:
Capturing Cairo between the overthrow of Morsi and Mubarak, Bialobrzeski’s images portray daily life in the Egyptian capital at a time of major urban, social and political upheaval and renewal.

Limited Edition: 1000; Format: Section-Sewn; Dimensions: 104 pages, 140 × 210 mm; ISBN: 978-1-908889-20-1
